intro: Licania arborea, commonly known as the red mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in coastal areas and estuaries. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red bark and its ability to thrive in saline environments. Its roots form a complex network that helps stabilize coastal sediments and provides habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms. Licania arborea plays a vital role in the ecological balance of mangrove ecosystems.
